eps.name: Hepatitis and Lemon Zest
eps.desc:
Christy is having recurring nightmares about relapsing. Marjorie says she used to have them all the time, and suggests that Christy help out another addict, so Christy approaches a new attendee at the AA meeting named Jill (Jaime Pressly) and takes her under her wing. Later, Bonnie greets the landlord at the door, who tells her Christy is three months behind on rent. Christy admits she gambled away what little money they had, trying to win enough for the rent. Bonnie and Marjorie come up with enough money for one month's rent to keep the landlord at bay, but Christy, hearing Chef Rudy place a bet on a college football game, can't resist trying to multiply one month's rent into three months' rent. Though she wins her bet, she gets mugged after cashing in, which forces the family out of the house and into a motel.

Title Meaning: Christy spreads a rumour about a rival waitress and has to endure Chef Rudy's taunts.

eps.name: Figgy Pudding and the Rapture
eps.desc:
The family becomes essentially homeless, after an incident in the motel room two doors down drives them out. Alvin goes to visit Christy at the old house and finds it abandoned, except for Baxter who is using the shower. The landlord shows up and says Christy fled in the middle of the night, which irritates Alvin.

Title Meaning: Bonnie makes a sarcastic prayer and Baxter's deluded explanation for finding Christy's house empty.

eps.name: Chicken Nuggets and a Triple Homicide
eps.desc:
Christy and Bonnie meet a woman at an AA meeting who rents them a beautiful house in the country at a ridiculous discount. After avoiding the issue, the realtor finally admits that three people and a dog were murdered in the house. Meanwhile, Bonnie plays mediator between Alvin and Christy, and the two eventually make up.

Title Meaning: Christy brings fast food home for Roscoe and the rented house's history as a murder scene.

eps.name: Forged Resumes and the Recommended Dosage
eps.desc:
Christy starts worrying when Violet's behaviour starts mirroring her own from her drinking days. She reminds Violet that the reason she gave up her baby was to commit herself to school and build a future, but Violet says she can't do that while not knowing if her baby is safe. The two visit the Taylors and Violet sees that her child is being well cared for. Meanwhile, Bonnie tries unsuccessfully to lie her way into several jobs before finally getting one as a building manager, which also will provide the family with a free apartment.

Title Meaning: Bonnie's series of unsuccessful job interviews and Christy's allergies to Marjorie's cats.

eps.name: Kimchi and a Monkey Playing Harmonica
eps.desc:
Christy has ambivalent feelings about Baxter's new wealthy girlfriend Candace (Sara Rue). Meanwhile, Bonnie and Alvin's relationship begins to heat up, which disturbs her.

Title Meaning: Baxter begins learning Korean for an overseas job and Bonnie discovering a YouTube meme while settling into her new job as building manager.

eps.name: Crazy Eyes and a Wet Brad Pitt
eps.desc:
Christy and Bonnie are in the lap of luxury when Christy's wealthy sponsee, Jill, asks them to keep her company in her lavish home on her first night out of rehab, but soon discover that Jill's frequent relapses might be too much for them to handle.

Title Meaning: Jill's erratic behaviour towards Christy and Bonnie watching a movie in Jill's home theatre.

eps.name: Extra Mashed Potatoes and a Drunk Clown
eps.desc:
Following an awkward encounter with an old classmate, Christy is on a journey to right the wrongs of her past, but she has a blind spot when it comes to Baxter. Following Christy's example, Bonnie decides to come clean with Alvin about the terrible things she did to him over the years.

Title Meaning: Bonnie attends to a tenant's apartment and her confessions to Alvin about her past.

eps.name: Free Therapy and a Dead Lady's Yard Sale
eps.desc:
When Bonnie and Christy catch Violet cheating on Luke, they get her to visit a therapist, but a painful family secret comes out when they are asked to join Violet's therapy session.

Title Meaning: The therapist at the free clinic and Bonnie's dealing with the death of a tenant.

eps.name: Godzilla and a Sprig of Mint
eps.desc:
Christy's evening alone takes an unexpected turn when she meets her attractive, single neighbor, Andy (Colin Hanks). Also, Bonnie and Alvin's romantic plans are derailed by Alvin's ex-wife, Lorraine (Beverly D'Angelo).

Title Meaning: Alvin's nickname for Lorraine and his dinner date with Bonnie.

eps.name: Nudes and a Six Day Cleanse
eps.desc:
After realizing she's been a waitress longer than she planned, Christy takes steps towards a new career. Taking advantage of a chance encounter in her AA group, she agrees to intern for a competent but creepy lawyer. Also, Bonnie and Alvin try to recapture their youth.

Title Meaning: A case file Christy handles and her reprimand from Violet.

eps.name: Three Smiles and an Unpainted Ceiling
eps.desc:
Just as Alvin and Bonnie take a big step toward a committed relationship, with Alvin moving into the apartment across from Bonnie's, his unexpected death rocks the Plunkett household.

Title Meaning: Bonnie's term for sex with Alvin and the vacant apartment opposite hers.

eps.name: Kitty Litter and a Class A Felony
eps.desc:
While trying to cope with her own grief after Alvin's death, Christy is forced to perform damage control when Bonnie begins acting out and the rivalry between her and Lorraine intensifies to ridiculous degrees.
Absent: Matt L. Jones as Baxter, Spencer Daniels as Luke and Blake Garrett Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title Meaning: Christy's substitute for Alvin's ashes and Bonnie breaking into Lorraine's house to steal the ashes.

eps.name: Cheeseburger Salad and Jazz
eps.desc:
Christy is concerned with the way Bonnie is processing Alvin's death and tries to get her professional help. Making things more difficult, a couple of men who bear a resemblance to Alvin come into their lives.
Absent: Nate Corddry as Gabriel, Matt L. Jones as Baxter, French Stewart as Chef Rudy, Mimi Kennedy as Marjorie and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Bonnie's order at a Hooters-style restaurant and her conversation with a tow truck driver she tries to date.

eps.name: Benitos Poppins and a Warm Pumpkin
eps.desc:
When Christy suddenly gets promoted to manager of the restaurant, she discovers that being the boss comes with its own set of problems. Also, Bonnie has a nemesis in the building who tries to get her fired.
Absent: Matt L. Jones as Baxter, Mimi Kennedy as Marjorie and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Christy's twisting of Gabriel's metaphor for a successful manager and Bonnie's blackmailing taunts in a tenant meeting.

eps.name: Turkey Meatballs and a Getaway Car
eps.desc:
After hiding from Claudia in a suitcase in Gabriel's motel room, Christy discovers that she enjoys sex most when there's a risk of getting caught. Meanwhile, Marjorie nominates Bonnie to be the next secretary of the women's meeting, but Bonnie takes the role a little too seriously.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Bonnie recounts a near-relapse while grocery shopping and Marjorie's memories of running with the Black Panthers.

eps.name: Dirty Money and a Woman Named Mike
eps.desc:
While visiting their friend Regina in prison where she is getting paroled early, Christy and Bonnie are shocked at how prison has changed her into a religious fanatic. Christy is also quite relieved when Regina quickly forgives her for gambling away the stolen money she had given Christy for safe keeping.
Absent: Nate Corddry as Gabriel, French Stewart as Chef Rudy, Spencer Daniels as Luke and Blake Garret Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title Meaning: The money Regina left with Christy before getting arrested and Marjorie's rememberances of a former cellmate who was a scrounger.

eps.name: Raw Cookie Dough and a Misshapen Head
eps.desc:
Christy and Bonnie start getting worried when they discover that Violet is dating a psychology professor who is more than twenty years older than her. Their anxieties start to intensify after she gets engaged to him.
Absent: Nate Corddry as Gabriel, French Stewart as Chef Rudy, Mimi Kennedy as Marjorie and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Christy losing a coin toss and Bonnie's queries into Violet's reservedness over introducing her boyfriend.

eps.name: Dropped Soap and a Big Guy on a Throne
eps.desc:
Christy and Bonnie face temptation when Bonnie is prescribed pain medication for a back injury: Bonnie succumbs, and the episode ends with a To Be Continued screen.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Nate Corddry as Gabriel, Matt L. Jones as Baxter, French Stewart as Chef Rudy, Spencer Daniels as Luke and Blake Garret Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title Meaning: Bonnie's slipping in the shower that resulted in her injury and her drug-induced conversation with a pair of missionaries.

eps.name: Mashed Potatoes and a Little Nitrous
eps.desc:
Bonnie begins relapsing in secret, but is soon found out, leading to a great rift between her and Christy. Christy gets a call from Bonnie late that night, with Bonnie saying she got a DUI and asking to be bailed out. Christy tells her mom to wait in jail until the next morning. The episode ends with a To Be Continued screen.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Nate Corddry as Gabriel, Matt L. Jones as Baxter, French Stewart as Chef Rudy and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: A dinner date interrupted by Bonnie's sensitive tooth and the dentist she dates offering to help, leading to them both getting intoxicated.

eps.name: Sick Popes and a Red Ferrari
eps.desc:
After Bonnie's relapse, the women from her meeting rally around to help her through withdrawal and get her sober again, but a still-furious Christy wants no part of it.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Nate Corddry as Gabriel, Matt L. Jones as Baxter, French Stewart as Chef Rudy, Spencer Daniels as Luke and Blake Garret Rosenthal as Roscoe

Title Meaning: Christy's fury over the amount of care Bonnie is receiving and Jill describing her own mother's suicide by asphyxiation.

eps.name: Patient Zero and the Chocolate Fountain
eps.desc:
Christy and Bonnie's contentious relationship makes them unwelcome guests wherever they go.
Absent: Sadie Calvano as Violet, Nate Corddry as Gabriel, Matt L. Jones as Baxter, French Stewart as Chef Rudy and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Christy's pandemic-themed joke about Bonnie's resentment and an elaborate decoration at Marjorie's secret party.

eps.name: Fun Girl Stuff and Eternal Salvation
eps.desc:
When Roscoe announces that he wants to live with his father in his new house, Christy's world starts to collapse and her resentment against Bonnie comes to a head. However, she is forced into reconciling with Bonnie after her attempts to move out backfire.
Absent: Nate Corddry as Gabriel and Spencer Daniels as Luke

Title Meaning: Jill's plans to celebrate Christy moving in and Regina admonishing Jill for an insult to her religious nature.
